elements.2211.03178_cf6f0e9a87161df0afab5748ea1f3: This article introduces a dynamic spatiotemporal stochastic volatility (SV) model with explicit terms for the spatial, temporal, and spatiotemporal spillover effects
elements.2211.03178_cb2fde5e197c598d52f81aa7e0bc2: Moreover, the model includes time-invariant site-specific constant log-volatility terms
elements.2211.03178_7a063dac12224de561e15a021c882: Thus, this formulation allows to distinguish between spatial and temporal interactions, while each location may have a different volatility level
elements.2211.03178_07ac554a3ec32457d1c577bd27893: We study the statistical properties of an outcome variable under this process and show that it introduces spatial dependence in the outcome variable
elements.2211.03178_9821489ddcfd243dd6cd3d3653c4c: Further, we present a Bayesian estimation procedure based on the Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) approach using a suitable data transformation
elements.2211.03178_0105b09b2966eb98020099de4778b: After providing simulation evidence on the proposed Bayesian estimator's performance, we apply the model in a highly relevant field, namely environmental risk modeling
elements.2211.03178_8f2c41d1284cdad6bcb5ff6837a9e: Even though there are only a few empirical studies on environmental risks, previous literature undoubtedly demonstrated the importance of climate variation studies
elements.2211.03178_f11450b44377c66aa1fb2f1c1b1e2: For example, for local air quality in Northern Italy in 2021, we show pronounced spatial and temporal spillovers and larger uncertainties/risks during the winter season compared to the summer season.
elements.2211.03178_45cf5e3d78e25340b6b284f1ac5cc: Keywords: Environmental risk, MCMC, spatial dependence, spatiotemporal stochastic volatility, air quality
elements.2211.03178_0204c394fd7b8b28b71f1b1e2dbb9: When analyzing geo-referenced data, statistical models have to account for instantaneous spatial correlations due to the geographical proximity between the observations
elements.2211.03178_8b0aaf5fda28f1a6995794283db20: This is commonly known as Tobler's first law of geography
elements.2211.03178_f849db50122ed8a8bb54f769eb790: everything is related to everything else, but near things are more related than distant things
elements.2211.03178_91dd446512c7b5ca3d8c7d3b39270: This observation was already noted by Ronald A. Fisher in 1935 as follows,
elements.2211.03178_938ab9ad8f9a744edbdffaafb4e7c: the widely verified fact that patches in close proximity are commonly more alike, as judged by the yield of crops, than those which are further apart
elements.2211.03178_92bde43bd143d35ac6bd4ebfecdb1: Even though the similarity is typically considered to be in the (conditional) mean level at each location, there might also be spatial correlations in the (conditional) variance or variation of the random process
elements.2211.03178_88c47acdb4f4b34620ed28116958f: In particular, for small-scale spatial units, the variance of the process is increased
elements.2211.03178_c5f517b03dc8a43cddbdf9930394f: In addition to the instantaneous spatial correlations, we also have to account for the natural temporal correlations, which usually occur if we repeatedly observe a random process over time
elements.2211.03178_6dd72a5bc8362d65af2db706fc2bb: The closer two observations are to each other in time, the more strongly they can correlate in general
elements.2211.03178_c9e2d7bc8bda419ecd466b3852e7f: In this paper, we introduce a new model for spatial, temporal, and spatiotemporal correlations in the log-volatilities allowing for additional random errors in the mean and volatility equation
elements.2211.03178_112d567a5a354845b29f89c8c2375: Furthermore, we apply this model to environmental data and show for the first time how it can be used to analyze environmental risk factors such as air pollution
elements.2211.03178_7624aab4e2ad63193323fcaae87b9: There are generally two ways to account for spatial/cross-sectional correlations in spatial statistics
elements.2211.03178_88b10a600737c885b7b5d313f94e8: Firstly, it can be modeled in the covariance matrix of the process, where each entry is supposed to follow a certain (non-)parametric covariance function depending on the distance between their locations
elements.2211.03178_92be6bf6ee45adccc345f8c67f134: This idea is typically known as the geostatistical approach
elements.2211.03178_dc01da232dc298cd35c80225f7439: The selection of a suitable parametric covariance function with certain properties such as stationarity, separability and full symmetry is one of the main modeling issues of this approach
elements.2211.03178_cb3b225c202b69a36ec13affdd8fc: for a review on the spatiotemporal covariance functions suggested in the literature
elements.2211.03178_697ee69da7041eed69257bef76eba: Secondly, the observations on an outcome variable can be explicitly correlated with the adjacent observations, where the adjacency is defined fairly generally by a spatial weights matrix
elements.2211.03178_799a13758e840081c2ea620a0b1f3: This second approach is referred to as spatial autoregression in spatial econometrics, where the spatial lags of variables are used to model spatial correlations
elements.2211.03178_61bec2eb3ad34c8311b20c4cfb94f: on the specification and estimation issues in spatial econometrics
elements.2211.03178_3ded132e07f18443bb5c17b55330c: Both approaches can be equivalent under certain conditions
elements.2211.03178_d40494c84c0e760bc1beb0b0ed39c: \citep[see e.g.][for simultaneous and conditionally autoregressive models]{ver2018relationship}
elements.2211.03178_df6c71349f6aa534b0b590d043b98: In this paper, we consider the second approach
elements.2211.03178_ca6d9e6e663d9ddd323f019b567d9: Our model consists of an outcome and log-volatility equation with separate independent error terms, whereby the log-volatility process introduces spatial dependence in the outcome variable
elements.2211.03178_cc94871e2099a9c60d0b45c3684eb: Specifically, the log-volatility equation allows for spatial, temporal, and spatiotemporal correlations, as well as time-invariant site-specific effects (unobserved heterogeneity)
elements.2211.03178_120440ac29e34a2fb17ba4e7b5aef: Also, assuming that the error terms in both equations have normal distributions, it is possible to show that the outcome variable has a leptokurtic symmetric distribution under our suggested model
elements.2211.03178_dd17b25fb040495d6541060e7bfdf: To introduce a Bayesian estimation approach, we use a transformation approach such that the outcome equation becomes linear in the log-volatility terms
elements.2211.03178_a57312ff1a4f40c6d1f7fba2cefb2: We use a Gaussian mixture distribution to approximate the distribution of the transformed error terms in the outcome equation
elements.2211.03178_14e7d1405b946b9f5a6f3a9f9a7e3: This approximation turns our model into a linear state-space model, where the log-volatility equation becomes the state equation
elements.2211.03178_0164eeb3d04e689e551c763dd1147: Following recent developments in the precision-based algorithms
elements.2211.03178_362f27b09264fb3ae87a95f83aa31: , we suggest a Gibbs sampler that consists of five steps for the estimation
elements.2211.03178_90fd48dc925c22ffe5251ff502b8c: We provide simulation evidence showing that the suggested sampler can perform satisfactorily
elements.2211.03178_5d0c786a77ce5f271c268ad147555: Theoretically, our paper is related to the spatial econometric literature that addresses the presence of cross-sectional correlations in higher moments of spatial data
elements.2211.03178_5d572ff9e624f83892d7219b672fc: This strand of the literature considers the spatial extensions of generalized autoregressive conditional heteroskedasticity (GARCH) and stochastic volatility (SV) models to account for volatility clustering patterns observed over space
elements.2211.03178_c5073267cbda7956c90e0e483413d: Our model can be considered as the longitudinal data (panel data) extension of the cross-sectional spatial SV models suggested by
elements.2211.03178_6a754ce279e65ebc42495525283d2: While these studies allow for the presence of spatial dependence in the log-volatility equations, they do not include temporal, spatiotemporal and unobserved heterogeneity terms in the log-volatility equations
elements.2211.03178_2dd992f399ef2ee1efead6a4014a3: Our suggested process is also related to the separable and non-separable space-time filters considered in the spatial panel data models for modeling spatiotemporal interactions
elements.2211.03178_fc820089613c37f6130685a821971: consider a separable space-time filter for the outcome variable, while
elements.2211.03178_6e85ec17745e35860c6a8535a9038: consider non-separable space-time filters for the disturbance terms of spatial panel data models
elements.2211.03178_707146d4773c79ef93e1f58a98bcf: In contrast to these studies, we consider a general space-time filter that also allows for unobserved heterogeneity, i.e., the site-specific effects, for the log-volatility of an outcome variable
elements.2211.03178_7371393cc7de451a8d901b2272d46: In an empirical application, we use our suggested model to assess environmental risk stemming from the variations in the log-volatility of air quality predictions
elements.2211.03178_e7f0bc80e5966b5bb27a9f1a3d48a: Spatial and spatiotemporal interactions in the local climate and environmental risks were addressed in comparably few studies in previous empirical research, even though it has been shown that an increased variation in environmental processes can be harmful
elements.2211.03178_90f2f2a70db7da60b21719e880bd1: Most previous studies focused on correlations in the (conditional) mean levels of ecological processes
elements.2211.03178_4133c95d9f4cfaa69007c8ff66512: In our case, we model the log-volatility of fine dust concentrations of particles having a diameter less than
elements.2211.03178_597190cfaf5000c437f691d19ced3: Following the literature on the ecological processes
elements.2211.03178_1c565c4831b0a347f5016428e0ad1: , we first model the variation in the conditional mean of our outcome variable through a conventional spatial panel data model that allows for the unobserved site and time heterogeneity
elements.2211.03178_b405d0cd51431c440b2f1afa78ca3: Our results from this initial model indicate that there is strong and moderate spatial correlations in the outcome variable in the model with only site fixed effects and the model with both site and time fixed effects, respectively
elements.2211.03178_92a1eba7a14fe8296ba41c1fc7e8d: In the next step, we use the errors from this initial model as an outcome variable in our suggested specification and aim to model the variations in its log-volatility terms
elements.2211.03178_1bf65addea5233f752a3b481569ec: The estimation results from our suggested Bayesian approach indicate that the spatial and temporal effects in the log-volatilities are moderate while the spatiotemporal effects appear to be of minor importance
elements.2211.03178_78b9535d17229c6327b2d5dbbb958: We were also able to detect a noticeable variation in air pollution risk across the year and identify measurement stations that are associated with higher risks
elements.2211.03178_1271ab2aff2c68ecbc05f414de7e8: These are mostly located in valleys in the Alpine regions.

elements.2211.03178_ecfd7310ef14e2f578282e0941192: , we provide the details on the posterior analysis of our model, and state an algorithm for the estimation

elements.2211.03178_b70f60dac9b5ec3b1f14fbef5a614: We observe that the Bayesian estimator performs satisfactorily and seems to mix well in all cases

elements.2211.03178_505b24289b6e38a031772ef7034f4: Air Quality Modeling and Environmental Risks
elements.2211.03178_4dd0ed66559b78246a1f56a640c87: In this section, we demonstrate the usage of the dynamic stochastic volatility model using an empirical example from environmental science
elements.2211.03178_357abea7d2660a3af4b08e8fca1e4: Like for applications in financial economics, the volatility of the process can be interpreted as risks (i.e., environmental risks in our case)
elements.2211.03178_079d28a83d903ad97de4229066787: Previous ecological studies mostly focused on changes in the mean behavior
elements.2211.03178_4d36e45f6d57a2c892b95cfe4c36e: , but also an increased variation might be harmful, e.g.,
elements.2211.03178_a2b17fd7de7c3cba9d80eba8c9375: showed that an increased temperature variation (i.e., changes in the variance) poses a greater risk than global warming (i.e., changes in the mean)
elements.2211.03178_f54c1a423f5e378085b550f59c4c0: Similar results on this topic were found by
elements.2211.03178_587c856ef037dc79933a5ccad4a97: Moreover, there is also a connection between climate changes and the financial market, such that climate variations might have an impact on the risk of financial markets (see also
elements.2211.03178_072b4ba6bf757d80de5c305ce4516: In this article, we analyze the variation of fine dust concentrations of particles having a diameter less than 10
elements.2211.03178_ee67b1cd71cf689e9c06129586295: The region is surrounded by the Alps from the west, so that the wind circulation is reduced and Lombardy becomes one of the regions in Europe with the lowest air quality
elements.2211.03178_e07d8f7d13e46f1c802bfdc3b3d85: In the following empirical analysis, we use the daily
elements.2211.03178_6d8ce9d6c6185a4e1c82515faf289: concentrations from 1.1.2021 to 31.12.2021 from the official monitoring stations of the regional environmental authority, ARPA Lombardia
elements.2211.03178_adb2fc55a73d2925b7c06e22c4197: The data are open-source provided by the Agrimonia project
elements.2211.03178_5e6ad585452b4c5c7e86b13daa7ae: To provide a first overview of the dataset, we depicted the median concentrations in
elements.2211.03178_e948da2d67a1201b50340d5656448: across space and time as a time-series plot (Figure
elements.2211.03178_d6fc410bede1c89ef4bf5fe64ceae: For our analysis, we first estimated a spatial panel model to describe the mean variations
elements.2211.03178_dc5a91810f0e57c47c2ec34e43064: The spatial correlations have been modeled in an autoregressive manner
elements.2211.03178_a7bfb153bb37bb7bcd9f3667af11c: To be precise, the mean model is given by
elements.2211.03178_33ba2cb630373978e5ca38f7fd80f: is spatial weights matrix which we specify below in more detail,
elements.2211.03178_ecaa03053e416b2497d3f3344d3b9: Spatial interactions are included via the spatial autoregressive term
elements.2211.03178_d772be2cd0025e7d3286d63aa680e: are present for each station (even if non-significant), because there are different types of stations included in the data set, e.g., urban traffic stations located at major roads in the cities, or rural background stations located in the Alps
elements.2211.03178_f0e4c51768f5533a8c466139e4ff2: The spatial fixed effects describe the station-specific
elements.2211.03178_d3585103955f1d79b6925e4ace378: concentrations and thereby serve as the model intercept
elements.2211.03178_dbab610cfaef369cb840de81a1bea: We refer to this model as Model A. Moreover, we consider the same model with spatial and temporal fixed effects as an alternative model B, that is,
elements.2211.03178_386e9779f632b5e1b74d49b66223c: will remove any additional (station invariant) seasonal variation across time, which is not explained by the exogenous regressors
elements.2211.03178_61af1f38d9ba4b09ce0e625f63ff5: covariates that are known to influence PM concentrations, namely the maximum height of the planetary boundary layer (PBL), the relative humidity, the air temperature, and the pressure level
elements.2211.03178_fc122b3abf0511713566e2c022b7c: All covariates are available as daily observations for each measurement station
elements.2211.03178_45c6177655ee78f00c007d2fdaa8d: Moreover, they were standardized to compare the size of the effects
elements.2211.03178_ab7c2524e04a88692fd29783dff3b: The spatial weights matrix has been chosen as row-standardized binary contiguity matrix, where all locations within 15 miles are considered as adjacent stations
elements.2211.03178_851077c983ab1309be0f8827ed9a7: On average, each stations has 5.2621 neighbors leading to a sparsity level of
elements.2211.03178_97adeb7913748998837699c172f9d: using the maximum likelihood approach implemented in the spatial econometrics MATLAB toolbox (cf.
elements.2211.03178_efdacfebac66ab7e02de40337bb7f: The resulting estimates including their asymptotic 95
elements.2211.03178_2599963b4ff0fe0ec9004b7578dcc: confidence intervals are summarized in Table
elements.2211.03178_1d3bd3bd759bb0fbcf157b00728dc: The estimated parameters are in line with our expectations and we see a good general fit of the model (
elements.2211.03178_b56cf953c159fc278d3ff22ed1fea: with only spatial and spatiotemporal fixed effects, respectively)
elements.2211.03178_f6bcfb3bc2d8cc771697b13c45228: However, for this paper, our focus is not on the mean variations but on the model errors
elements.2211.03178_cf9c8a3c362a8ebd7107178a03090: Hence, we do not go into further detail on the interpretation of the mean models
elements.2211.03178_a7b3d95d232030f65f7aed82e5634: The errors of the mean model represent the unexplained variations and, therefore, the environmental risks
elements.2211.03178_ed361aa4faf209059fe1527c62a12: When considering the standard deviation of
elements.2211.03178_c805423656282743a907af117c09b: at each time point and/or for each measurement station, we see that the error variance is varying across space and time (see Figure
elements.2211.03178_d013446592e81737e7f4307e097b6: There are time periods of increased variations, so-called volatility clusters, e.g. at the end of the year
elements.2211.03178_823accc2e5f83d72769f75dc1a5f4: Moreover, we observe a similar clustering across space
elements.2211.03178_c66922d8a263629bdf36b899c3d92: Measurement stations with a higher volatility are located in close proximity, e.g., North-East of Milan or around Brescia
elements.2211.03178_e5606e2cbf19eccf2685cff6521fe: This provides motivation for estimating a dynamic stochastic volatility model for
elements.2211.03178_dedddcf526457495584bd9047a083: in the second step, that is,
elements.2211.03178_de96a76c97f349ad401aabd8de5b3: reports the median of the posterior draws for each parameter including the corresponding 95
elements.2211.03178_528fa8b3885de4c89b130f30bc2e1: credible intervals (500,000 posterior draws, and 100,000 burn-in draws)
elements.2211.03178_ef1c32a7f79ce79dcd439761870c8: In general, we observe moderate instantaneous spatial interactions (i.e.,
elements.2211.03178_6893f2696b421fd9d5543dc747694: for Model B) and temporal autoregressive interactions (i.e.,
elements.2211.03178_2d028f7292992f8a0ec86257540f1: for Model B), while spatiotemporal effects appear to be of minor importance (i.e.,
elements.2211.03178_fea5b7ccf385320e103cb9ee0f766: for Models A and B, respectively)
elements.2211.03178_916ecf1925a6ca2cc6c9e7766dce8: The posterior mean estimates for both the spatial and temporal autoregressive parameters are positive
elements.2211.03178_f6e61f9d3fda6fb09c1ee80bed214: That is, if the environmental risk (log-volatility
elements.2211.03178_b1f5e25500c3dee8608fd1331c957: ) is high it is likely to spillover to the neighboring regions and to future time points
elements.2211.03178_dbdf5de3dd9962baac3d6a8af027c: For this reason, spatial and temporal volatility clusters are formed
elements.2211.03178_0df3665b95aacf02d3802b8e7bb83: The negative signs of the posterior mean estimate for the spatiotemporal lag are opposing this behavior, but they are close to zero
elements.2211.03178_3d6b44af041297ecc84cc708df566: Moreover, we observe that the spatial spillovers are dominating the temporal ones for Model A without temporal fixed effects
elements.2211.03178_839e547697739569a2587062d4b98: That is, the missing temporal variation of mean model could be picked up within the uncertainty model
elements.2211.03178_15790ddbb72195a3b1c4d3162269a: When including both temporal and spatial fixed effects (i.e., Model B), the spatial dependence in the volatility of the errors is reduced, while the temporal dependence (i.e.,
elements.2211.03178_9b5b811b09364505c7a5ac1067848: When looking at the overall volatility level represented by the average
elements.2211.03178_b3b7e8ccf80155c769908717203a5: , we see that the model uncertainty is reduced because of the additional temporal fixed effects in the mean equation
elements.2211.03178_c1f50b6ac7630d9054eb36817590d: Nevertheless, all space-time interaction parameters are significantly different from zero indicating a space-time dependence in the local uncertainties of the environmental process (here: the particulate matter concentrations)
elements.2211.03178_57be2bdbe50cbc2fcea27f7258a52: Moreover, we analyzed the conditional volatilities for each station across the time horizon
elements.2211.03178_22f5842e2f53b60c95ff49368d763: For Model B, the results are displayed in Figure
elements.2211.03178_88278c471f5844c8fec4f456bb47f: as a time-series plot (left) and on a map (right)
elements.2211.03178_d3710414b2191e706bf5c6e5f7dea: More precisely, we computed the posterior medians of
elements.2211.03178_d69d11dff736ee1b300839bbb67c4: for all locations and time points leading to an estimate of the
elements.2211.03178_9fbc23f8648fcea8d471cabfa0c94: matrix of the logarithmic conditional volatilities
elements.2211.03178_ed2a6b63f06ce72ab7e21246cb8b9: Then, for visualization, we computed the median and the 5
elements.2211.03178_cb7ea0585438c374c897689476390: quantiles of these estimates across all spatial locations (see time series plot) and across all time points (see map)
elements.2211.03178_926ff587d040ad2426d7ab3719489: From the time series plot, we see that there is a clear annual pattern
elements.2211.03178_ab3fc3ed7489bfcff4618ce8b4cc8: the model uncertainties are lower in summer and highest in winter
elements.2211.03178_7d5bc7cdd913c6624f34bf6b56776: These varying conditional volatility levels can be interpreted as environmental risks, which are the highest the winter season
elements.2211.03178_a4dd1a1972f6cb3b44aeca4e8640c: In the same manner, measurement stations with a greater uncertainty/risk can be identified from the map
elements.2211.03178_f7b94a4484f7fa08d94ce7f4a08a4: They are mostly located in valleys in the mountain areas.
elements.2211.03178_febc760d91e2809aa68e04f5ba44b:

elements.2211.03178_6b77a4ef7582c84588eac763921e5: We have introduced a novel spatiotemporal statistical model for stochastic volatilities, which are spatially, temporally, and spatiotemporally correlated and have different levels for each location reflecting the heterogeneity of the process across space
elements.2211.03178_fe45cbb987ebe0e09edd1c729fd92: The model includes two different error terms for the mean and the log-volatility equations
elements.2211.03178_f4f5dad39fad56bfc92deaa804435: To estimate the parameters, we suggested a Bayesian MCMC approach
elements.2211.03178_2b0fc3e31aa0c47a7c40878c65844: To this end, we applied a log-square transformation to transform our non-linear state-space model into a linear one
elements.2211.03178_04a4086e7e20ec7b91ea4ac7bac5e: Further, we used a Gaussian mixture distribution to approximate the distribution of the transformed error terms in the space equation, transforming our model into a linear Gaussian state-space model
elements.2211.03178_1f06d4a3219879f6acae912bbaa14: We analyzed the estimation performance for different parameter settings and spatial interactions in a simulation study, and showed that the suggested Bayesian sampler performs satisfactorily
elements.2211.03178_068148100c7106beec1dc4c4a5ba6: Moreover, we applied the dynamic spatiotemporal stochastic volatility model in a completely new empirical framework, namely, in the field of modeling environmental and climate risks
elements.2211.03178_0628b66db4de6bc687645900c8ace: First, statistical modeling of the volatility process of climate variables have not been done extensively yet, even though there is a large scientific consensus that an increased variability of environmental processes, e.g., the temperature variability, is harmful for the environment
elements.2211.03178_5c890f66a8e45bdc9c3394ed0b311: Second, stochastic volatility models were predominantly applied to financial data, because of the straightforward interpretation of the log conditional volatilities as the (return) risk of financial assets
elements.2211.03178_53a00e8f3c19fba4893971b9f9241: We have transferred to this idea to environmental risks and showed how the volatility of
elements.2211.03178_8c3f5c30f10cbb2f73b47063effe9: predictions are correlated across space and time
elements.2211.03178_ca3ecdd2d2f480cf194cb3a1badd7: In particular, measurement stations with an increased model uncertainty could be identified in this way
elements.2211.03178_e69a9ea946b9b3b2d1a1006ec21ff: In addition, we showed in our application that there are significant temporal and spatial spillovers in these environmental risks
elements.2211.03178_5d89ef23487dcceb9b7ca7d264b7f: Also, the temporally lagged spatial spillovers, i.e., the spatiotemporal correlations, appear to play a minor role
elements.2211.03178_efd0a400a7ea189bc34ad9ed4244d: Both from a theoretical and applied perspective, spatiotemporal stochastic volatility models and environmental risk modeling are important topics for future research
elements.2211.03178_f3db8994b7421feb8f211c28fd87f: The current model does not allow for temporally varying constant terms in the conditional volatilities, which are constant across space
elements.2211.03178_7e69bc047c7192690941205203b68: Regarding the latter case, other environmental processes, like temperature variations, soil droughts, or atmospheric ozone concentration and optical depths are important processes, where a deep understanding of the spatiotemporal interactions in the variabilities is essential, both for obtaining accurate prediction intervals and the planning of interventions (and their impact on the environment).
